answer_found_by_llm: No user credentials or root password were found in the memory dump. The analysis using various Volatility plugins did not yield any exposed credentials, indicating that either there are no credentials present or the commands executed were not compatible with the memory dump.

No evidence of file access for 'users.db' was found in the memory dump. The analysis using various Volatility plugins did not yield any results indicating that the file was accessed, suggesting that it may not have been present in memory at the time of the dump.

Several suspicious files were identified in the memory dump, including multiple `.tmp_` files in `/root/LiME/src/` and various files in `/tmp` with unusual extensions. However, I was unable to calculate their MD5 hashes due to permission issues and missing files in the specified locations.
The potential malicious actor was identified with the IP address and port number: 10.0.2.72:1337, indicating suspicious activity on a non-standard port.

No evidence of scheduled tasks or cron jobs was found in the memory dump. The analysis using various Volatility plugins did not yield any results indicating the presence of cron job files or scheduled tasks.

No evidence of cron job files was found in the memory dump. The analysis using various Volatility plugins did not yield any results indicating the presence of cron job files or the commands being executed by any cron jobs.
